result.execSummary:
The defendant Dwayne Steven Kohler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment plan: $75/mo. Starting on or before 05/15/2022

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwayne Steven Kohler

records.addlTxt:
01:55 PM ADA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Dwayne Steven Kohler appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Fuhr states an agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. ADA Fuhr states Victim's Rights Legislations have been complied with. Defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to an Attorney. Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY to the sole count in this matter.   Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. Comments by parties. 
Court Imposes:
$300 Fine 
$200 DNA + Sample 

Monetary obligations: $75/mo starting on or before May 15, 2022 Like payments there after until paid in full OR one day in jail for every $25.00 then owing.


Appeal Rights Given
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Dwayne Steven Kohler
Current: 226 South Argyle Ave, Phillips, WI 54555 United States  (Effective: 03-01-2022)
Prior: 226 S. Argyle Ave., Apt. 3, Phillips, WI 54555

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.
Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): C.N.N. unless a written waiver is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office or the Price County Sheriff's Office outside of normal business hours
 * No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

10:06 AM Defendant Dwayne Steven Kohler appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
